main event: A witness in Berlin, Germany reported seeing a bright, round object with a red flaring tail moving quickly across the sky on December 21, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as being about 8-10 meters in diameter, with a brilliant white body and a red flaring tail.
The object was observed for only about 2 seconds as it moved from west to east.
The witness reported the object was reflecting light from the ground below and did not make any noise.
The witness reported the sighting to local authorities in Berlin.
The Air Technical Intelligence Center of the U.S. Air Force investigated the sighting and concluded the object was likely a meteor.
sighted object: a bright, round object with a red flaring tail
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
